definition: to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Each month we reconcile our check book with the bank statement.
sentences.chinese: 我们每个月都把支票簿与银行结账单核对一次。

sentences.english: Now where did I leave my checkbook?
sentences.chinese: 我把我的支票簿放哪了？

sentences.english: Don found checkbooks under four different aliases.There were letters in Mr.
sentences.chinese: 唐找到本用了四个不同化名的支票簿。

sentences.english: The checkbook is upstairs in the bedroom.
To his consternation, he realized that he had left his chequebook at home.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到他把支票簿留在家里就惊惶了。

sentences.english: Open the checkbook, and protests will stop.
sentences.chinese: 打开支票簿，抗议活动即将停止。

sentences.english: Americans who have to balance their checkbooks get this.
sentences.chinese: 美国人谁必须平衡他们的支票簿得到这个。

sentences.english: Don found checkbooks under four different aliases.
sentences.chinese: 唐找到本用了四个不同化名的支票簿。

sentences.english: They want to rob my cash and cheque-book.
sentences.chinese: 他们要抢我的现金和支票簿。

sentences.english: Attendance was up on last year, with more cheque-books in evidence.
sentences.chinese: 出席人数较去年有所上涨，支票簿增加即可佐证。

definition: book/notebook/Japanese-style self-published comic (esp. an erotic one), aka "dōjinshi"/CL:本[ben3]/edition
(in former times) banknote with a value in silver
to fish out/to take out (from a pocket, bag etc)
